intro: Dyschoriste poliodes var. glabra, commonly known as smooth dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its smooth, hairless stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
